intro: Phaseolus vulgaris f. albidus, commonly known as the white kidney bean. This variant is a cultivated form of the common bean, characterized by its pale yellow to white pod and seeds. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant thrives in warm climates and is often grown for its edible seeds, which are used in various cuisines around the world.
